newsitem.title: USA: Reno wants to remain as Clinton's attorney general.
newsitem.headline: Reno wants to remain as Clinton's attorney general.

text.p: Attorney General Janet Reno made clear Thursday that she wants to serve another term at the Justice Department if President Clinton wins re-election and asks her to stay on.
"I would be honoured and I would look forward to it," Reno said at her weekly news conference when asked if she would like to remain in her current post as the nation's chief law enforcement officer.

"But it would be the president's decision to make," she said. Asked if she expected to be renominated based on the job she has done, she replied, "I always let the president make those kinds of decisions."

There has been speculation that Reno, 58, who suffers from Parkinson's disease, a degenerative illness that causes trembling and muscular rigidity, might return to Florida after the November presidential election.
Reno emphasised that her health had not become a problem, even though her left hand shakes at times. "I still walk and canoe, and (am) having a fairly good time."
She recounted a story from Republican Sen. Alan Simpson of Wyoming, who told her that his father had been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease at age 65 and lived for 28 more years.
